intro: Anthenantia hagenbeckiana, commonly known as the Hagenbeck's anthenantia, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Violaceae and is characterized by its striking violet-blue flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant has a compact growth habit with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical forests. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is the subject of conservation efforts.
